newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australian petroleum exploration near record.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australian petroleum exploration near record.

text.p: Australia's Bureau of Resource Sciences said on Wednesday the level of Australian offshore petroleum seismic activity in the first nine months of 1996 was the second highest on record.
Spokesman Paul Williamson said the September quarter figures indicated an upcoming surge in drilling activity.
"So far this year, more than 245,000 line kms of offshore seismic data were recorded, over a third more than last year," Williamson said in a statement.
"This amount of data collected is extremely encouraging for future increases in exploration drilling, possibly leading to increased discoveries of new fields."
He said a large survey in the Timor Sea had contributed more than 40 percent of the line kms shot so far.
Offshore exploration drilling accounted for 38 wells, or eight below the near record level reported for the same period last year, he said.
